FindingName: VULNERABLE - One or more of the Safe Link Settings do not match the CIS Benchmark, thus Safe Links is not correctly configured
Description: Safe Links for Office applications extends phishing protection to documents that contain hyperlinks, even after they have been delivered to a user.
Remediation: 1. Connect using Connect-ExchangeOnline. > 2. Run the following PowerShell command: New-SafeLinksPolicy -Name 'My SafeLinks Policy' -IsEnabled $true -AllowClickThrough $false -EnableSafeLinksForTeams $true -ScanUrls $true -DeliverMessageAfterScan $false -EnableForInternalSenders $true -DoNotAllowClickThrough $true
DefaultValue:
IsEnabled: True
AllowClickThrough: True
DoNotAllowClickThrough: False
ScanUrls: True
EnableForInternalSenders: True
EnableSafeLinksForTeams: True
ExpectedValue:
IsEnabled: True
AllowClickThrough: False
DoNotAllowClickThrough: True
ScanUrls: True
EnableForInternalSenders: True
EnableSafeLinksForTeams: True

References.Text: Correct Settings - IsEnabled: True | AllowClickThrough: False | DoNotAllowClickThrough: True | ScanUrls: True | EnableForInternalSenders: True | EnableSafeLinksForTeams: True
Set up Safe Links policies in Microsoft Defender for Office 365
